text:
Svidrigaïlov lit a candle. He donned his waistcoat and overcoat. 

He stepped into the dark corridor. 

“Where is that attendant?” he muttered. 

Suddenly, he spotted movement. 

A little girl huddled in the corner, shivering. 

Her clothes were soaked. 

She looked up at him with wide, black eyes. 

“Why are you here?” he asked softly. 

She sobbed, “Mammy will beat me.” 

“What happened?” 

“I bwoke a cup!” 

She babbled about her mother, fear evident in her voice. 

Svidrigaïlov’s heart ached. 

“Come with me,” he said, extending his hand. 

She took it, trembling.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Svidrigaïlov discovers a neglected, shivering little girl hiding in a dark corner of the hotel, revealing her fear of her mother and the harshness of her situation.
